arts.ttl: Patrik Schick hat-trick fires Bayer Leverkusen fightback against Heidenheim
arts.sum: Patrik Schick netted an impressive hat-trick as Bayer Leverkusen fought back from 2-0 down to secure a 5-2 victory over Heidenheim at the BayArena. Schick's performance was a masterclass in finishing and positioning, turning the tide of the match decisively in Leverkusen's favour.

arts.ttl: Leverkusen fear Terrier has suffered serious hand injury
arts.sum: Bayer 04 Leverkusen head-coach Xabi Alonso revealed that his club's medical department are currently very concerned for Martin Terrier after the Frenchman incurred a fresh injury in Saturday's league win

arts.ttl: European football: Inter thrash Verona as Leverkusen hammer Heidenheim
arts.sum: Five goals in the first half for Simone Inzaghi’s team Diego Simeone wins his 700th game in charge of Atléti Inter hammered lowly Verona 5-0 away from home to move top of Serie A overnight, with all five goals coming in the first half. Joaquín Correa opened the scoring after 17 minutes, before Marcus Thuram added a quick-fire double and Stefan de Vrij and Yann Bisseck also found the net. “We managed to win a very important match,” Inter’s coach, Simone Inzaghi, told DAZN. Continue reading...

Bayer Leverkusen striker Patrik Schick bagged a hat-trick on Saturday to help the German champions battle back from a two-goal deficit and crush Heidenheim 5-2 in the Bundesliga. Leverkusen completed their comeback seven minutes after the restart with Florian Wirtz cutting back and Schick beating his marker to flick in the hosts' third goal of the afternoon.

arts.ttl: Schick hat trick helps Leverkusen cover defensive lapses. Dortmund and Stuttgart win in Bundesliga
arts.sum: Patrik Schick scored a hat trick and injury-hit Bayer Leverkusen overcame a scare before beating Heidenheim 5-2 in the Bundesliga on Saturday. Heidenheim then stunned the defending champions when Marvin Pieringer won the ball from Piero Hincapie and set up Niklas Dorsch to open the scoring in the 10th minute.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Leverkusen, Hoffenheim, Dortmund, Stuttgart, and Wolfsburg all victorious
arts.sum: There were no draws in the latest set of five Bundesliga 15:30 kickoffs. Czech internationals Patrik Schick (Leverkusen) and Adam Hlozek (Hoffenheim) were instrumental in helping their teams complete comeback victories. Elsewhere, Stuttgart and Dortmund took care of business with clinical home wins. Wolfsburg also secured their first home win of the season. Coverage of all five simultaneous kickoffs can be found below.

arts.ttl: Hofmann ruled out for the rest of 2024
arts.sum: Jonas Hofmann will miss the rest of 2024 due to a muscle injury, Bayer Leverkusen have announced.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen vs Heidenheim Predicted XIs: Patrik Schick to start ahead of injured Victor Boniface
arts.sum: Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen will be without Victor Boniface for the remainder of 2024 after the Nigerian picked up a thigh injury while on international duty, meaning that Patrik Schick…

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen vs Heidenheim preview: Champions in need of post-international reset
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso will be hoping his Bayer Leverkusen side can get back to winning ways when they host struggling Heidenheim at the BayArena on Saturday for their 11th Bundesliga match of the season.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen’s Victor Boniface to miss the rest of the year with a thigh injury
arts.sum: Sky Germany reports that Bayer Leverkusen’s Victor Boniface will be out for the rest of the year with a thigh injury he picked up on international duty. Boniface is said to…
